channel.title: mod_type on ThingsDB documentation
channel.description: Recent content in mod_type on ThingsDB documentation

item.title: add
item.description: Adds a property to an existing Type. Since version v0.9.2 an initial value is no longer required when having active instances of the given Type. If the initial value is omitted, then the default value according the Type definition will be applied. Action mod_type(type, 'add', name, definition, [init]) Arguments Argument Type Description type str Name of the Type where the property has to be added to.

item.title: del
item.description: Deletes a property from an existing Type. The property will be removed from all the active instances of that Type. Action mod_type(type, 'del', name) Arguments Argument Type Description type str Name of the Type where the property has to be removed from. 'del' str Passing this argument will result in a delete action. name str Name of the property that has to be removed.

item.title: mod
item.description: Modifies the type definition of a property from an existing Type. When modifying a property of a Type, the changed property type can only be less ‘strict’. So for example, age: 'int' can become age: 'int?', but not the other way around. Action mod_type(type, 'mod', name, definition) Arguments Argument Type Description type str Name of the Type where the property has to be modified from.

item.title: ren
item.description: Rename a property from an existing Type. Action mod_type(type, 'ren', name, to) Arguments Argument Type Description type str Name of the Type where the property has to be modified from. 'ren' str Passing this argument will result in a modify action. name str Name of the property that has to be modified. to str New name for the property that has to be modified.
